answerText: Ngugi wa Thiong'o [accept either name; accept James Thiong'o Ngugi][10] In addition to A Grain of Wheat, Ngugi wa Thiong'o also wrote a novel titled Petals of this substance. This bodily fluid is also used to describe a "knot" in a play by Athol Fugard as well as a "wedding" in a play by Federico Garc√≠a Lorca.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 2 | 6 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Non-fiction works by this author include the 2010 memoir Dreams in a Time of War and 1981's Detained: A Writer's Prison Diary. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author who is better known for a novel set in during the Mau Mau Rebellion in which the resistance leader Kihika is hanged after he is betrayed by Mugo.
